text:
Have you tried out the rings?

There are so many different exercises you can do on the rings in the functional rig. Here's a simple exercise you can try out to strengthen your back muscles as well as your overall pull strength. 

A key tip for this exercise is: The closer your back is to the ground, the harder the exercise becomes. So adjust your angle according to your level üëçüèª

Give it a go and tag us! And if there's anything you'd like to see around our gym just speak to our qualified instructors and they will help you out.

#wellbeingwednesday #unigym #studentgym #studentfitness #studenthealth #fitnessgym #stayactivestayfit #unisport #unisportlife #healthystudent #studentwellness #studentwellbeing #citysport #citygym #cityftness #fitness #fitnessclasses #fitnessclass #onlinefitness #onlineclass #reopening #membership

text:
Two secret gardens for the price of one! Have you found the Drysdale Garden yet? Hidden between the University, College, Drysdale and Centenary Buildings, it's a great sun trap around lunchtime. You can access it from level 1 Drysdale or through the University Building archway. 
Over at the back is City's Walled Garden, a sustainability project run by staff and students. Who said you have to be in the countryside to grow your own produce?
#citystudyabroad #mycityuni #london #garden #gardensofinstagram #autumn

Hidden between the University, College, Drysdale and Centenary Buildings, it's a great sun trap around lunchtime. You can access it from level 1 Drysdale or through the University Building archway. Over at the back is City's Walled Garden, a sustainability project run by staff and students. text:
üéì| "As the world begins to heal from the tribulations of the past two years. Accordingly, I wish to take this opportunity to thank the staff, as well as our families and friends who have facilitated our success - in good times as well as hard.

"There is no greater emblem of the brave new world which we now inhabit than the virtual existences that we have recently weathered. As technologists, we believe in the undeniable utility that computing has had, and will yet have, in solving these and other problems. The challenge of the coming era, and therefore for us, is to temper this vision with an ethical and wise perspective, to render what we create a true force for good.

"It is vital to remember that information is not necessarily wisdom, a video call is not always a dialogue, a follower not always a friend, and a like not always a sign of affection."

- Raffi Maurer (BSc Computer Science)
#CityGrad

As technologists, we believe in the undeniable utility that computing has had, and will yet have, in solving these and other problems. The challenge of the coming era, and therefore for us, is to temper this vision with an ethical and wise perspective, to render what we create a true force for good.

"It is vital to remember that information is not necessarily wisdom, a video call is not always a dialogue, a follower not always a friend, and a like not always a sign of affection."

- Raffi Maurer (BSc Computer Science) School of Mathematics, Computer Science and Engineering City STEM
#CityGrad

text:
Olaudah Equiano was a slave who was able to buy his freedom by saving up ¬£40 over 3 years! 

He eventually settled in England where he wrote two editions of his memoir which was hugely successful and made him rich from the royalties he earned. 

Not only was he one of the first black authors in Europe but his ability to tell the first hand horrors of slavery led to a change in public opinion and in 1807 Britain had formally abolished the slave trade.

#OlaudahEquiano #cityuniversityblackhistorymonth #blackhistorymonth #blacklivesmatter #blackcivilrights #ukblackhistorymonth #ukblackhistory #cityuniversity #cityuniversitystudentsunion #cityuniversitysu #cityunisu #cityuniversityoflondon #cityuol #cuol #studentsunion #university

text:
Library Services are pleased to announce that we now have access to Audit Analytics: Corporate and Legal through the WRDS Platform. Audit Analytics is a company intelligence tool useful for topics like investments, accounting, insurance, law, and regulatory issues. We already have the sister dataset to this product, Audit Analytics: Audit and Compliance, which you can use to investigate how firms have been audited, changes in company directors and other officers, and look at things like auditor fees, financial restatements and non-timely filings....

https://blogs.city.ac.uk/library/2021/10/13/audit-analytics-corporate-and-legal/

text:
üéì | "My time at City truly nourished my love of learning and curiosity. I‚Äôm really excited to be in the process of publishing my university research project, and hope to come back and study for a masters. Other than marrying my husband, coming to City to train as a Speech and Language therapist, has been the best decision I‚Äôve made.

"What‚Äôs special to me about City, is the feeling of community. I felt a real sense of community and purpose among my class and our department. I have fond memories of sitting in Myddleton chatting with class mates and tutors. I have fond memories of working for WP ‚Äì City‚Äôs Widening Participation team ‚Äì taking primary school children on tours of the campus and doing workshops with them. Despite being in the heart of a big global City, this university really cares about making an impact in its local community. Some of those very same primary school children who visit City, go on to study here."

- Rachel Preston (BSc Speech and Language Therapy)

#CityGrad

üéì| "City always felt like a home within London ‚Äì a city that could at times feel scary and overwhelming. The lecturers were always so passionate, societies so welcoming, and fellow students so dedicated. The fact that we‚Äôve all come back here today ‚Äì more than a year later after many going into new exciting careers or further education ‚Äì is a testament to City‚Äôs sense of community and feeling of 'home'. 

"We need strong, passionate, and educated young people to speak up for our generation, taking the knowledge acquired at City and using it to truly leave a mark on the world -  after all, that‚Äôs the power of the Arts and Social Sciences. Congratulations to everyone once again, Class of 2020!"

text: "I felt a real sense of community and purpose among my class and our department." #CitySHS student speaker, Rachel Preston (BSc Speech and Language Therapy), reflects on her time at City.
linkedText: "I felt a real sense of community and purpose among my class and our department." #CitySHS student speaker, Rachel Preston (BSc Speech and Language Therapy), reflects on her time at City.

text:
üéì | "My time at City truly nourished my love of learning and curiosity. I‚Äôm really excited to be in the process of publishing my university research project, and hope to come back and study for a masters. Other than marrying my husband, coming to City to train as a Speech and Language therapist, has been the best decision I‚Äôve made.

"What‚Äôs special to me about City, is the feeling of community. I felt a real sense of community and purpose among my class and our department. I have fond memories of sitting in Myddleton chatting with class mates and tutors. I have fond memories of working for WP ‚Äì City‚Äôs Widening Participation team ‚Äì taking primary school children on tours of the campus and doing workshops with them. Despite being in the heart of a big global City, this university really cares about making an impact in its local community. Some of those very same primary school children who visit City, go on to study here."

- Rachel Preston (BSc Speech and Language Therapy) City Health Sciences 

#CityGrad

text:
When you arrive to CitySport please help us creating a safe and clean environment for all by paying attention to our ground rules.

1. Stay home if you are unwell
2. Wipe down all equipment after use with antibac spray and paper towels provided
3. Return all weights and equipment to the designated place after use
4. Do not drop weights on the floor as this can cause injury and damage surfaces
5. Arrive on time for your scheduled activities (fitness classes, team training, sports hall activities etc.) and leave promtly after you finish
6. Wear suitable training kit for your activities (always have a change of sports clothes, jeans are not allowed)
7. Non-marking footwear must be worn at all times (always have a change of sports shoes with you)
8. Bring your own waterbottle or purchase one at reception. (Don't bring glass bottles in)
9. Always keep your personal belongings in the lockers provided (don't leave bags and jackets in the gym or on sports hall benches)
10. Do not bring food into any areas

Thank you for your cooperation!

text:
This week we're looking at some quotes from key figures. 

Phillis Wheatley was a living illustration that black people could be both artistic and intellectual. Her poems reached far and wide, making her a household name among the higher classes.

Her work and what it symbolised acted as a catalyst for the abolition of slavery.

text:
üéì | "Today is a day of celebration, for all the hard work and resilience that got us to this moment despite the pandemic. A day of reflection, because it marks the end of an important chapter of your life and the beginning of something new. 

"Just as Bayes‚Äô Theorem suggests, we get closer to the truth by constantly updating our beliefs in proportion to the weight of new evidence. Every step you take, every triumph, every fallback, adds a new piece onto the jigsaw puzzle called our future. Sometimes you feel lost ‚Äì you feel that you‚Äôve messed up. Several days passed and you‚Äôre convinced that the puzzle is impossible to complete. Suddenly, you stumbled onto a piece that had fallen to the ground ‚Äì it was the missing piece to complete your enigma. Sometimes all you need is to fearlessly wander in the woods and put things in perspective. No step is ever wasted, just like any setback. And who knows, you might just become the very best version of yourself in the process!"

- Pei Yi Ellie Goh (BSc Banking and International Finance) @uniquellie_peiyi @bayesbschool 

#CityGrad

Published at the end of July, the long-awaited government strategy, which seeks to address the barriers encountered by the UK‚Äôs 14.1 million #disabled people, made clear the need to increase employer engagement with the disability #employment agenda, and the requirement for employers to help address the barriers disabled people encounter in finding and retaining work.

However, the strategy should prioritise immediate action and focus on substantive policy change as opposed to consultations and reviews of existing policy.

READ MORE: Government disability strategy fails to address barriers to employment for disabled people - http://ow.ly/j5tQ50G2kNF

text:
In honour of World Mental Health Day, we wanted to highlight the importance of this subject and the precedence it should take in your life, as well as remind you of the support you have available at City.

If you need a safe place to share how you‚Äôre feeling and get support through courses & resources, join @Togetherall today using your academic email address.

You can also join one or more of the weekly mindfulness sessions taking place from 12:30 ‚Äì 1pm every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, run by CEMR. Anyone is welcome to join. The sessions are delivered through Zoom. Please contact Dr Jutta Tobias Mortlock  for details on how to join the session.

You can also make the most out of @citymentalhealthsociety, which was established with one ambition in mind, to encourage students to 'Be Good to Yourself'. The society will: 

‚Ä¢	provide a safe space for students so they can be open about their struggles 
‚Ä¢	work with the fantastic mental health services at university to raise awareness about the importance of good mental health
‚Ä¢	encourage students who come to them with struggles to seek necessary help. 

Finally, don‚Äôt forget that The Student Counselling, Mental Health and Accessibility Service includes four teams which provide practical, emotional and specialist disability related support to students. They offer a range of services to meet diverse, individual needs and support you to manage your wellbeing and fulfil your potential whilst studying.  You can find additional advice to support your studies and wellbeing on their Moodle page. 

For more information on this, check out our latest Student Hub article here: http://ow.ly/nMvU50GolkR ,or use the link in our bio.
@cityuniversitylondon
@cityunisu

text:
Today is World Mental Health Day 2021 and the theme is ‚ÄòMental Health in an Unequal World‚Äô. 

2020 highlighted inequalities due to race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical illnesses and the lack of regard for human rights in many countries, including those living with mental health conditions.
 
This campaign provides an opportunity for us to come and act together to highlight how inequality can be addressed to ensure people are able to receive the support they need.
 
We all have a role to play to address these disparities, so at Bayes, we thrive to support ALL our students to ensure that everyone feels supported and are able to achieve their best while studying with us. #WorldMentalHealthDay #WMHD2021 #MentalHealthAwareness #StudentSupport #BayesBusinessSchool

This campaign provides an opportunity for us to come and act together to highlight how inequality can be addressed to ensure people are able to receive the support they need. We all have a role to play to address these disparities, so at Bayes, we thrive to support ALL our students to ensure that everyone feels supported and are able to achieve their best while studying with us. @WorldMentalHealthDay @WMHD2021 @MentalHealthAwareness @StudentSupport @BayesBusinessSchool

text:
Elderly patients with neurological conditions are significantly more likely to develop delirium shortly after they are hospitalised.

A new study has discovered that a delayed transfer to a hospital floor is associated with greater short-term risk of delirium among patients aged 65 and over, and for those who arrive to the Emergency Department (ED) on days with higher risk of prolonged lengths of stay ‚Äì found to be Sunday and Tuesday.

READ: Better healthcare management can reduce the risk of delirium, a common hospital complication among older adults - http://ow.ly/ht6d50FFa07

text:
Betty is another important person and we should remember the impact of her life's work during this Black History Month.

She fought against discrimination and worked her way up the ranks in her career. Her teaching methods have even become a template for multicultural teaching in other schools.

text:
#PeopleOfCity | Today we‚Äôre shining a spotlight on Andrew Boateng, course officer in the School of Arts and Social Sciences (SASS). Passionate about developing the skills and opportunities for young people, this is Andrew's story...

"I am #ProudToBe a father, son, brother, coach, youth manager and mentor, a Ghanaian, a spokesperson for Stand up to Racism, and an active member of City's Network for Racial Justice, for staff at City. I will soon be moving into a newly created student engagement team operating within SASS which will enable the team to more closely support individual students through any difficulties they may face during the course of their studies at City.

‚ÄúI live in Tottenham and love the community spirit. There is always some form of community event taking place. Whether it's a talent showcase in the park, sporting activities, creative arts or an exhibition at the Bernie Grant centre. My background is in sport, having played youth team football for various professional teams including Chelsea, Brentford and Southend Utd, and also work as a football scout for Crystal Palace FC. Some of my time is also spent on police and youth engagement initiatives, often linked to sports, to help build bridges between police and young people.

"#BlackHistoryMonth is a good time to reflect, come together and celebrate diversity in society. But just as a dog is not just for Christmas but for life, I and so many others have also always maintained that Black history is not just for October ‚Äì but for 365 days of the year. Large sections of society do not suddenly stop being Black on November the 1st. 

"Over the coming months, I'm looking forward to getting started in the new student engagement officer role and exploring better ways to support students in need. I'm also looking forward to helping to organize The Stephen Lawrence Day Event awards, a joint project with the Rio Ferdinand Foundation, Kickoffat3 and Take the Reins, which aims to take inner city youth out of the city and give them opportunities to get behind the scenes of more ‚Äòrural‚Äô sports, such as horse racing, with a view to also providing employment opportunities." ‚ú®

text:
October is black history month. For the occasion we are going to share 4 inspiring stories of our own people.

Week 1
Jesse is from Barking and has been working as a Fitness Instructor at CitySport since June¬†2021.¬†His keen interest in basketball saw him represent Middlesex University, winning the accolade of player of the year in¬†2017.¬†Jesse also captained his team to an undefeated year in the¬†2018¬†British Universities & Colleges Sport (BUCS) league, winning the South Eastern trophy. The success of his team resulted in playing in the finals of BUCS Big Wednesday in¬†2018.
¬†
After graduating in¬†2018, Jesse fell in love with boxing and decided to join Finchley Boxing Club, where he currently trains alongside Heavyweight Champion Anthony Joshua. Jesse‚Äôs current record stands at six fights, with five wins and one loss.
¬†
Inspired by Jesse‚Äôs achievements? Try one of our Black history in the making fitness challenges and see if you can beat the target for a chance to win a prize.
¬†
How many skips or punches can you perform in 30 seconds?

#blackhistorymonth #blackhistorychallenge #blackhistoryhero

text:
Your Sabbatical team and union were there earlier today to support the cleaners and caterers at City University, who have much worse terms and conditions than everybody else working in your university. This is because they are hired through external private companies. 

They are the ones who made sure the buildings were sterilised and clean enough for you to come back. They are the ones who provide you with breakfast, lunch and dinner every day. 

We stand in solidarity with their cause to make them in-house, so that they have access to the same benefits as everyone else who works at City!

Let‚Äôs end outsourcing!

#InHouseInCity

text:
Supported by the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council), the four-year INclusive digital Content for people with #Aphasia (INCA) joint research project of the School of Mathematics, Computer Science and Engineering‚Äôs (SMCSE) Centre for Human-Computer Interaction Design, and the School of Health Sciences (SHS) has investigated, co-designed and trialled digital content creation and curation tools for people with aphasia from July 2017 to July 2021.

This multi-disciplinary project brought together human-computer interaction researchers, speech and language therapists, academia and charity working together. INCA was led by Principal Investigator, Professor Stephanie Wilson, in partnership with the Stroke Association and Dyscover.

READ: Celebrating City‚Äôs INCA project - http://ow.ly/d2cb50FwnYV

text:
10 facts about nutrition for Wellbeing Wednesday supported by @dare.motivation

Balanced nutrition is key to feeling healthier and happier and therefore can bear a direct influence on your day to day motivation and your ability to feel like you are performing at your peak everyday.
To WIN some goodies from @dare.motivation
enter our monthly gym challenge!

High Fibre:
Include foods rich in fibre (such as fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and legumes) into your diet can benefit your digestion and reduce your risk of chronic disease.

Carbohydrates Aren‚Äôt Your Enemy:
This is your body's main source of energy, used to fuel your brain, kidneys, heart, muscles, and nervous system. It aids digestion, fills you for longer, and keeps cholesterol in check.

Omega-3 Fats Are Essential, But Most People Don‚Äôt Get Enough:
Consuming essential Fatty Acids have shown to improve brain function, retina and joint health. Inflammatory and cognitive diseases can be reduced with an omega-rich diet.

Avoid Trans Fats:
These unsaturated fats found in fast foods, baked goods, and vegetable oils. Consuming it increases levels of ‚Äòbad‚Äô cholesterol, leading to blood clots, heart attack and stroke.

Up Your Vitamin D Intake For Optimum Health:
Vitamin D is important to keeping our bodies healthy. It helps by absorbing calcium for improving bone health and aids your immune system by fighting off harmful bacteria.

Stay Hydrated:
Drinking water with meals has shown to aid in promoting healthy digestion, flushing out bacteria from the bladder and transporting nutrients to your cells.

Have a Protein-Rich Breakfast:
A breakfast loaded with protein will aid in muscle growth, boosting your metabolism and repairing your body‚Äôs organs. It also reduces binge-eating and cravings.

Cut Back On Refined Carbs:
Medical cases show that consuming these in excess will lead to obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular diseases.

Avoid Fad Diets:
These can lead to dysfunctional eating habits and bad long-term relationships with. Other drawbacks include binge-eating, damage to your metabolism and elevated levels of Cortisol.

Fermented Foods For A Happy Gut:
These are rich in bacterial probiotics, useful fo

A maths degree can take you anywhere, but that also means you might find it hard to decide on a career direction.  Come hear from employers in a variety of fields about why they look for students with maths degrees.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
TONIGHT - 4th October, 6pm-8pm on Zoom.  Sign up and get the link at http://careershub.city.ac.uk.

text:
October is Black History Month in the United Kingdom when we focus on celebrating the contributions of black communities to this country and the wider world, as well as remembering the experiences and injustices of black people in the past and still today. Although the impacts of Covid-19 pandemic are still being felt, there are many ways to get involved in the celebration and opportunities of learning that this month brings, both in person and online....

https://blogs.city.ac.uk/library/2021/10/01/black-history-month-2021/

text:
Startup Camp is coming to City University next week!

The week of events include a talk and Q&A with the founder of Shazam and a panel about how you could be an entrepreneur as a student. 

Everything will come to an end with the Cityspark Grand Final on the 7th October!

For those who don't know, Cityspark is a huge business competition here at City, where 10 entrepreneurs compete for ¬£25k cash prizes.

This is one for all budding entrepreneurs out there, who want to learn more about pitching business ideas. 

Be sure to have a look at our story to see the full line-up and click the link in our bio to register your place!

@BayesBSchool @cityuniversitylondon

#cityspark #cityspark2021 #citystartupcamp #bayesbusinessschool ##businessatcity #businessdegree #ItBeginsWithBayes #BayesBusinessSchool #Mycityuni #cityuniversityoflondon #cityuni #cityunisu #londonuniversity #londondbudinessschool #londonbusiness #universityoflondon

VMock is a 24-7 online CV review tool which provides instant personalised feedback on your CV based on criteria developed by City's Careers Consultants and gathered from employers and global best practices.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
You can use VMock from anywhere, at any time of the day.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Sign in with your City email address and password. https://www.vmock.com/city/‚†Ä
‚†Ä
You can get started by uploading your CV draft, or start writing your CV directly in VMock using one of our CV templates.

text:
Journaling has always been one of the most useful tools for self improvement and development üìì ‚Å£
‚Å£
First, when we journal, we don‚Äôt feel judged, so we are better able to be honest with our feelings without the fear of what others might think of us. ‚Å£This could be a great tool when you think about your fitness and health journey!

Did you hear about the Holistic Body Journal from Valenson 
Well, envision a body-positive world where people aspire to get fitter and healthier because they love themselves.

And now you can WIN one if you enter our monthly gym challenge! 

Journalling drastically improves your quality of life. It let's you regain control over your emotions, which in turns give you much more stable mental health.

Another benefit of journaling is that it makes you feel accountable for your actions so there is less chance for you to make excuses when it comes to achieving your goals. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Finally, journaling allows you to reflect on your short- and long-term goals so you can see your target more clearly.‚Å£
‚Å£
We also have a DISCOUNT for our members. Use promo code CITYSPORT for 20% discount off when you order from @valenson

‚Å£#wellbeing #wellbeingwednesday

It's a new dawn..., it's a new term...., and it's new books and other resources at the Library! text:
How is Bayes' theorem used today? 

Tom Chivers, award-winning journalist, editor and author said: "It‚Äôs a vital, simple, enlightening equation, and I was thrilled to be able to talk about it.‚Äù 

‚ÄúBayes‚Äô theorem is especially relevant these days, because it helps us understand how new information can only be interpreted in the context of the information we already have. 

The pandemic has really shown the importance of clear and accurate reporting of numbers." 

#BayesTheorem #AlwaysLearning

text:
To the casual observer, City Law School alumnus D√©vante Gravesande-Smith represents the partial fulfilment of the dreams of any ambitious young person making their way into the competitive legal profession.

Currently working as a Clerk in the Central Criminal Court, D√©vante's achievements and ambitions have not come easy.

"Qualified black and ethnic minority barristers still face huge barriers in securing pupillages when compared to their white counterparts. Many of us from black backgrounds who have not attended Oxbridge or a Russell Group university are already at a disadvantage in the pupillage process.‚Äù

Read D√©vante's inspiring story üëâ thisis.city.ac.uk
.
.
.
#ThisisCity #MyCityUni

text:
From today, the School formerly known as Cass Business School officially becomes Bayes Business School ahead of the 2021/22 academic year.

Professor Paolo Volpin, Dean, Bayes Business School (formerly Cass), said: ‚ÄúInspired by Thomas Bayes' ideas, our approach as Bayes Business School will be to have the courage to do things differently. In essence we will be always curious, always bold and always learning." 

Read the full statement in our bio.

#BayesBusinessSchool #AlwaysLearning

text:
The pandemic has taken a toll on everyone, including university students who found themselves navigating a very different academic year.

For Bahlla, a Business Management student @bayesbschool, remote working provided a new opportunity to intern with an international start-up as part of City‚Äôs Micro-Placement Programme this year.

Despite the remote aspect of her placement, Bahlla felt there were many ‚Äúopportunities for learning‚Äù that allowed her to ‚Äúmeet amazing people that I would not have met otherwise‚Äù

Across the five weeks of placement, Bahlla worked on multiple projects from reviewing the company‚Äôs website and producing videos for their future interns to conducting competitor research and market sizing. She says, ‚Äúto get the full experience, I believe you must go above what you are expected to do.‚Äù

Read more at üëâ thisis.city.ac.uk
.
.
.
#ThisisCity #MyCityUni

text:
At @cityuniversitylondon our Music degree courses cover a huge range of musics - jazz, pop, experimental, classical and non-western musics, with an integrated and flexible approach incorporating historical and critical study as well as performance and technical skills. Specialist staff in all areas assist and guide whilst students develop their skills in our state-of the art facitilities. Bmus and BSc degee pathways offer differently balanced courses to suit different interests.

Take a tour of our studio facilities here : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fFjQjHORMFQ

Email for further info on applying to join us : joseph.browning@city.ac.uk

text:
"Being an investment banking practitioner in emerging markets, I come across amazing young people with incredible talent and second-to-none drive to pursue their dreams," says Miguel Azevedo, MBA in Finance (1989). 
 
"The constant pursuit of better solutions to the challenges of the world has been something I experienced as a young professional when I attended the MBA in finance. 

I can only fully subscribe and commend the Business School for its active stance on inclusion and diversity, helping many that would not have had the chance otherwise." 

#ChangingMoreThanAName

text:
HAPPY NEW YEAR! üöÄüíú‚†Ä
‚†Ä
1. We hope you had a lovely festive break!  We‚Äôre ready to take on a new year supporting aspiring entrepreneurs to accelerate their start-ups! ü§©‚†Ä
Last year, we had the opportunity to work with, learn from and connect with loads of fantastic entrepreneurs, communities and start-ups.  Swipe to take a look at what we got up to. üëâüèæ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
2. We welcomed over 20 brilliant start-ups for our impactful accelerator programmes!‚ö°Ô∏èWe are extremely fortunate to have support from our accommodating network of our workshop facilitators and mentors, and managed to host both programmes online.  From social media to sales, insurance to persona building, they covered it all!  Keep an eye out on our Instagram page for updates about our next cohort. üëÄ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
3. To help tackle the financial strain due to the pause in revenue generation during the pandemic, together with @cityuniventures, @cityuniversitylondon‚Äôs Research and Enterprise team and Santander UK Universities, we were able to provide over ¬£80,000 in grants to our members to allow them to pivot, build long term resilience plans and pursue new opportunities. üìù ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
4. Since the launch in March 2020, we hosted over 100 online mentoring sessions via our mentoring programme!üë®üèª‚Äçüíª Following the lockdown, we welcomed our fantastic community of mentors to host sessions for our members. Want to inspire, support and guide the next generation of entrepreneurs?  Click the link in our bio to apply to become a mentor. ‚†Ä

6. 2021 is here and we‚Äôre ready to continue supporting all things entrepreneurship! ‚†Ä

text:
Happy Friday all! üöÄüí´

How was your week?

Swipe through to have a peek at what we‚Äôve been up to recently:

1. We have been full steam ahead with the accelerator programme with out October 2020 cohort. So far we‚Äôve learnt a lot - the fundamentals of start-up law, the importance of insurance, how to build an effective marketing strategy and social media tacticsü§©ü§©

2. Better Space - We have recently welcomed the lovely Sam to the team! Sam leads Operations at @betterspacelondon - an incubation space for the Change Makers striving to make a positive social impact! Go say hi on the instagram page @betterspacelondon! üôãüèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôãüèª

3. City Ventures - Have you been tuning in to the Startup Seminars? Every Tuesday, the @cityuniventures team have been delivering FANTASTIC seminars to give us an insight into startups from expert practitioners! Don‚Äôt miss their next seminar ‚ÄòHow Do You Build an Awesome Brand‚Äô (link in bio)! üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª

We‚Äôve been nosing around some of our members accounts, check out what they‚Äôve been up toüí•:

4. @EMenuNow - A big congratulations to the team at @EMenuNow after securing significant funding from Innovate UK! üëèüèºüëèüèø

5. @GetOcushield - The iPhone 12 Mini and Pro Max are here!üì± @GetOcushield have developed screen protectors with blue light filters, antibacterial tech and tempered glass protection! Look after your eyes - shop at Ocushield!

6. @Leiho_UK - Christmas is coming (42 sleeps)!! @Leiho_UK now offer sock crackers and we honestly can‚Äôt think of a better surprise for the family! Go check them out! üß¶

7. @NativeNous - Lockdown 2.0 means limited access to salons and spasüòìüë©üèø‚Äçü¶± Not to worry, one of our newest additions, @NativeNous, has been keeping us informed of the benefits of using natural oils found in their hair and skin range. Look after yourself - check out their rangesüíÜüèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüßñüèΩ

8. @Seek_Fit - Been keeping up with those 5K runs? üèÉüèø‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüëÄ @Seek_Fit have released some top tips to reduce injury and relax your mind during this time! Need some advice? Check them out!

We hope you have a lovely weekend, remember to support small businesses,

The City Launch Lab teamüíú

text:
Today is Black Pound Day. Founded by @swissworld_, Black Pound Day is a solution-based approach to support the growth of the UK Black economy. The movement aims to underpin the long term financial growth, empowering and motivating the Black community.  Black Pound Day encourages everyone to spend money at Black owned businesses and helps to inform communities on how they can better support Black businesses. 

Check out BlackPoundDay.uk for further details.

Swipe to see the Black owned businesses which are part of the Launch Lab community and show your support for this fantastic movement.

Black Pound Day are currently fundraising, see the link in our bio for further details.

@bpdofficial @swissworld_

#blackpoundday #supportblackbusinesses #blackbusinessesuk
